content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Apr 2019What does it means if a company is in the mas investor alert list? ?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Loh Tat TianLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Apr 2019Basically it means1) There have been some "complains" that is related to investment, but they are not licensed by MAS2) There are promises of returns, but they are not financial advice3) There is no recourse for you (much) from MAS.4) The products are touted as "investment" mostly, yet does not have a formal structure for reporting of FY, etc etc that is governed and required in MAS rulings.0 comments0
Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Apr 2019It means you gotta be careful with these companies! They might be fraud companies. I would stay away from them if I were you.0 comments0

Ashley Wong, Financial Assistant at Multi Management & Future SolutionsLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 12 Apr 2019You should be extra cautous while dealing with such companies. As an investor you must be always be on alert. Do not get carried away by their claims of high returns with low risks. More info -  https://kat88investments.com/2013/11/01/what-does-it-mean-when-a-company-is-listed-in-the-mas-alert-list/0 comments0
